frame.name: Besieging
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Assailant</fen>, a group of armed forces, surrounds the <fen>Victim</fen>, a military location and the people within it, in an attempt to cut the <fen>Victim</fen> off from the outside, with the goal of either forcing their surrender or weakening them so that an invasion would be successful. A successful siege is often followed by the <fen>Assailant</fen> taking control of (the land held by) the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex><fex name="tim">Towards the end of the summer</fex>, <fex name="ass">a great English host</fex> <t>besieged</t> <fex name="vic">the Danish fort of Tempsford</fex> and took it, killing the last Danish king of East Anglia.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Assailant
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Assailant</fen> is a group of armed forces (or, metonymically, their commander or the organization they represent) that encircles, surrounds, or otherwise cuts off the Beseiged in an attempt to force surrender.</def-root>

FE.name: Victim
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Victim</fen> is the fortification or geopolitical entity that is being attacked.</def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Assailant</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Assailant</fen> that accomplishes the assault. </def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Source
FE.definition: <def-root>The starting-point of the motion of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or projectiles of the <fen>Assailant</fen> as they move toward the the <fen>Place</fen> that the <fen>Victim</fen> is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Weapon
FE.definition: <def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> to cause damage to the <fen>Victim</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Path
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Assailant</fen> travels. </def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition: <def-root>The length of time that the <fen>Victim</fen> is under attack from the <fen>Assailant</fen></def-root>
